definition[0]: to prepare and use land for growing crops and plants
example[0]: The land was too rocky to cultivate.
definition[1]: to plant and take care of a particular crop
explanation[0]: In everyday English, people usually say someone grows a crop rather than cultivates it:
example[2]: They have been growing grapes there for hundreds of years.
definition[2]: to work hard to develop a particular skill, attitude, or quality
example[3]: Try to cultivate a more relaxed and positive approach to life.
example[4]: The company has been successful in cultivating a very professional image.
definition[3]: to make an effort to develop a friendly relationship with someone, especially someone who can help you
example[5]: Professor Gladwyn would be an acquaintance worth cultivating.
example[6]: Some of the land would be impossible to cultivate.
definition[4]: to develop a particular skill or quality in yourself
definition[5]: to make an effort to develop a friendly relationship with someone who could be useful to you
